title: Sri Lanka rupee at 345/355 to TT dollar
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s commercial banks quoted the rupee at 345/355 for telegraphic transfers on April 28, remaining at the same levels as the previous day, while the secondary market remained mostly inactive ahead of the 35 billion bond auction, market participants said.
The central bank’s indicative spot was quoted at 341.85 rupees against the US dollar on Thursday, down from 337.9 rupees on Wednesday.
At the time of filing Central bank had not updated its telegraphic transfer rates for Wednesday.
On Wednesday the TT rates were 337.8/350.5, up from 333.88/346.5 against the US dollar.
Sri Lanka’s secondary remains inactive ahead of the 35 billion bond auction today.
At Wednesday’s weekly bills auction, the debt office offered and sold 87.5 billion rupees.
The bills are split into 42.5 billion rupees maturing in 3-months, 24.5 billion maturing in 6-months and 20.5 billion rupees maturing in 12-months.
Three-month bills sold the most after generating 78.7 billion rupees 23.53 percent, up 32 basis points from last week.
Only 1.1 billion rupees of 6-month bills were sold at 23.96 percent down from 24.77 percent a week earlier.
Another 7.6 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 24.09 percent down from 24.36 percent a week earlier.
